question: With DMPA, the next injection may be taken latest by:
exp: DMPA is effective for 13 weeks. It has grace period of 4 weeks, which means that this woman can get her next injection before completed 17 weeks. If she comes later than 17 weeks, then she will be given injection but will have to use backup for next 7 days, as injections would take time to become effective.
topic_name: Other FP Methods and New Initiatives in Family Planning

question: Laparoscopic sterilization is not recommended during the period of:
exp: - Laparoscopy is not advisable for postpaum patients for 6 weeks following delivery- Hence, option-1 is answer - However, it can be done as a concurrent procedure to MTP. - Hemoglobin should not be less than 8. - It is recommended that the patient be kept in hospital for a minimum of 48 hours after the operation.
opd: Post first trimester M. T. P
topic_name: Other FP Methods and New Initiatives in Family Planning

question: MC side effect of DMPA is:-
exp: MC side effect of DMPA is Disruptions of normal menstrual cycles ( most common) Depot Medroxy Progesterone Acetate ( DMPA) Is a progestogen only Injectable contraceptive ( Depot formulation ) Dose: 150 mg i/m every 3 months Advantage Highly effective Long lasting and reversible Does not affect lactation Side effects: Disruptions of normal menstrual cycles ( most common) Amenorrhea
topic_name: Other FP Methods and New Initiatives in Family Planning

question: Most cost effective family planning method is:-
exp: Sterilization is the most cost-effective contraceptive measure. - Vasectomy is most effective sterilization method than tubectomy. - Cost wise ratio is 5 vasectomies to 1 tubectomy.
topic_name: Other FP Methods and New Initiatives in Family Planning

question: A man underwent vasectomy, but 6 months later his wife was 16 weeks pregnant. What is the most likely cause?
exp: - Misidentification of Vas deferens by Surgeon is the MCC of Failure in Vasectomy.
opd: Failure to use additional contraception in postoperative period
topic_name: Other FP Methods and New Initiatives in Family Planning
